title: Simple Past vs. Present Perfect vs. Simple Present vs. Past Perfect

exercises.title: Simple Past vs. Simple Present vs. Present Perfect vs. Past Perfect

questions.question: I ................................ for hours but he didn’t come.
questions.description: The simple past is the most normal tense for talking about finished events.

questions.question: She ..................................... in several movies.
questions.description: We often use the present perfect to give news.

questions.question: The train ………………………….. a few minutes ago.
questions.description: The simple past is the most normal tense for talking about finished events.

questions.question: Make sure that you ………………………… on time.
The poor man made sure that his children never ………………………..
questions.description: When the main verb is in the past tense, the verb in the subordinate clause too will be in the past tense.

questions.question: You will get the promotion if you ………………………….. it.
questions.description: In the first conditional we use a simple present tense in the if clause and will + first form of the verb in the main clause.

questions.question: They realized that they ………………………… a major blunder.
questions.description: The past perfect is used for the earlier of the two past actions.

questions.question: We ……………………………. anything from them in over a month.
questions.description: The present perfect is used to talk about an action or situation that started in the past and has continued up to the present.

questions.question: They …………………………. two wickets before rain interrupted the match.
Dad ………………………….. home from work at
questions.description: The simple present is used to talk about habits and routines.

questions.question: Mother ………………………………. the weekends with her parents.
questions.description: The simple present is used to talk about facts and routines.

questions.question: She started crying as soon as she ………………………… me.
